label: Society & Culture
sentence:
Title: What should i do about my son when my husband is a cross dresser?
Question: my son is 7 months old. my husband wants a complete sex change but right now is cross dressing. Im worried. what should i do when my son is old enough to realize this. i wonder what is going to think
Answer: Hmmm?

I don't know that I see the problem.  What's your son going to think when he gets old enough to realize?  He's going to think "Daddy likes to wear girl's clothes.", or, if the sex change has already happened by then, then he'll have another mommy, I'm assuming.  Neither one is going to scar the kid, or even really affect him.  If he grows up knowing that there's nothing wrong or weird with his dad doing that, then he won't think anything of it (so long as the outside world doesn't know and tease him about it).  It'll just be one of the things daddy does, like mommy liking to put on her sweatpants to do the laundry or something similar, you know- just a little idiosyncracy.  And so long as he sees/understands that other men don't necessarily do it, he won't go raiding your closet (unless of course he wants to, which, in that case, you can't change it).  He'll grow up fine and healthy- just approach this with reason and rationality and show your son that you love him and your family is normal.

Good luck!

sentence:
Title: Is it best to raise Christian children in government/public school, private school, or home school?
Question: What system of education is best and why?
Answer: As a public school teacher, I would actually recommend home-schooling your children if at all possible. I send my daughter to a private Christian school. Some people think it's too expensive to send their kids to Christian school, but I tell you it doesn't cost any more than daycare. Most of you probably send your kids to daycare, don't you? Also, you can't put a price on a good Christian education.  They have smaller teacher:student ratios, they focus on academics, they learn good morals, they are allowed to worship as they please (in accordance with the 1st Amendment), they score higher than the national average on tests, and they help to create productive members of society. They are not crime-and-drug ridden like so many public schools. \nA public school would be the last place I'd send my child if I could help it.\nIf, however, I did have to send here there, I would be on those teachers, principal and school board like white on rice. I would give them notes saying that they are not to teach my children evolution or any sex education (especially presented by Planned Parenthood!) or any "diversity" training (which is really just pro-gay propaganda). I will NOT have my child brainwashed by the public school system. You should be aware that the creation of a free, public school system was one of the tenets of Karl Marx's Humanist Manifesto, which was implemented by Teddy Roosevelt in this country. In fact, most of the tenets of that Manifesto were accomplished in this country in the first half of the 20th century. We have slowly become a socialist nation.\nBefore that time, children were either home-schooled or private-schooled - and some of the best, most intelligent people our country has ever produced were educated thusly.

Question: What is Finite Element Analysis?
Answer: Finite Element Analysis (FEA) is a process in which you solve equations.  These equations can relate to stress, as mentioned above, but also heat, diffusion, chemical reaction, or anything you want.\n\nFEA is a system of solving these equations in which a large object is broken into many elements.  Then equations are solved for each element and stitched together to give the final answer.  The method is now pretty standard and optimized to give fast reliable results in many cases.

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Title: HELP i cant public speak i can't get my word's out &i go sooo red....what can i do to overcome this??
Question: ITs wrecking my life!!!
Answer: You might want to check out information on Social Phobia. This is one of the most common forms of anxiety disorders (more common than Agoraphobia). Over 7% of the population suffers from social anxiety disorder.

If you have social phobia you usually worry that others will notice your anxiety because of your blushing, sweating, shaking, or difficulty getting your words out, (for example).

Other fears triggered by social situations include:

    * I'll look uncomfortable or awkward
    * I'll seem weird or strange
    * I'll appear stupid or incompetent
    * I'll look embarrassed
    * I'll be boring

These fears tend to be triggered when just anticipating the social situation. You may also have noticed that, after the event, you often feel bad or worse when thinking about how you "performed". How you actually felt in the situation can play a big role in this "post-mortem". 

The Social Phobia/Social Anxiety Association, a non-profit organization, seeks to educate about social phobia:
http://www.socialphobia.org/

They list some good self help books here:
http://www.socialanxietyinstitute.org/bookstore.html

You should talk with your doctor and ask for a referral to a psychologist who specailizes in Anxiety Disorders.

label: Politics & Government
sentence:
Title: my boyfriend is a veteran and i need some advice.?
Question: he still has alot of issues he's dealing with over things he has seen and been through when he was in iraq, i want to be there for him (we've been together for over a year) but i still dont know what to do or say when he starts talking about things that happened to him and his friends.  Any advice on how to help him deal with it? I just usually listen to what he has to say, but i dont ever know what to say to make things better for the moment.
Answer: The best thing you can do is just listen.  The fact that he is talking to you about this is a great complement to you indicating that the trusts you and feels that you will understand.

If he appears to be having problems dealing with these events or is having nightmares, stress, fears, etc then he should be evaluated for PTSD.  Do not assume that the has PTSD just because he was in Iraq but if he is showing signs of distress find a local 'Veteran's Outreach Center' and talk him into going there.  Here he can be evaluated by a psychologist experienced in Combat PTSD and he can get assistance if he needs it.

If he needs assistance but does not want to go to the vet center - at least have him email me.

label: Computers & Internet
sentence:
Question: when i click on a mpeg rather than open it, it downloads it to a file. how do i just open it?
Answer: Certain file types that don't have proper program handlers will be downloaded on a click, rather than played in the appropriate program.

To fix that, right-click on an MPG file you do have and choose Properties

Where it says "Open With", click on the Change... button.

Select the program you want to have open the file and click OK.

Click OK again to close all dialog boxes.

sentence:
Title: Octogon has 8 sides. Octopus has 8 legs.?
Question: If "octo" is eight, Why is October the tenth month?
Answer: In most places, until the adoption of the Gregorian calendar, 25 March (the date known as the Annunciation of Mary) was the first day of the new year. Eventually this was changed to 1 January (a date associated with the Circumcision of Christ). Some of the month names indicate their position relative to the March year beginning - September, October, November, and December are formed from root words meaning "seven", "eight", "nine", and "ten", respectively. When the first of the year was changed to January, they became the 9th, 10th, 11th, and 12th months, but kept their original names.

sentence:
Question: How can a person go to sleep in the early evening without drugs.?
Answer: i have always been quite the insomniac. luckily for me, I'm on a night shift now, and seeing as i enjoy staying up late i just do and it's fine. however i wasn't always on a night shift so i can give u some of my techniques.

1.) first of all, u could try herbal supplements. Valerian root and melatonin are the two best. melatonin will always be in pill form that i know of, but it's just a replicate of the exact same chemical that your brain uses to put you to sleep. it's either the best stuff out there or it won't work at all. that depends on you. Valerian root on the other hand, has one major benefit for you. it doesn't to be a pill. u can actually buy this in it's natural form and i think u boil it in some water. the pills for valerian root and melatonin are the most convenient.  there may also be some herbal teas that have it.

2.)ur second bet is herbal teas. there are alot of them available a sleep aid and even if they don't have Valerian root they do have other things that work. and drinking something warm before u go to bed usually helps you go to sleep anyhow. warm milk can sometimes do it for me. you need to make sure, however, that you do not drink anything with sugar or caffeine in it at least 2 hours before you go to bed. if i have to go to bed at ten, i don't drink caffeine after 5 pm, or not at all if i can help it. also, u might try not smoking about a half hour before sleeping if u r a smoker.

3.) another thing u can try is a sleep CD. my friend Whitney swears by some of them. they have music or sounds or just gentle whispering and she says that some of hers will put u to sleep within 5 minutes of starting them.

4.) make sure that you have the most comfortable bed set up possible. if your like me, your body and mind love finding any excuse to get up, and the wrong pillow blanket and mattress is an easy target. i love the foam pillows but the foam mattresses suck for me. but it all depends on you. if you sleep in clothes, make sure they are soft and loose. it's better to sleep in the nude, however. also keeping a room a bit too cold for ur tastes but having plenty of cover is a great way to go to sleep. you'll wrap urself up tightly and u won;t move. soon you'll be asleep. i always sleep better in winter.

5.) reading or watching a television show that just DOES NOT INTEREST YOU is another way. i watch the news because i hate the news. sometimes the news can conk me out in the middle of the day. 

6.)there are plenty of meditation exercises out there and lots of them can relax you to the point of sleepiness. instructions for quite a few should be available on line, but try this one: breath in and fill your lungs all the way up. imagine that when you breathe in you are breathing in a number (the number one for the first breath and so on). fill ur lungs up completely with ones. then breath out all of the ones (emptying ur lungs completely) and then continue with the number two. sounds crazy but it does relax you and if ur laying on ur back in ur bed, it can actually put you to sleep.

i hope one of these works!!

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Title: what am i suppose to right for analysis, conclusion?
Question: it never sticks to my head....
Answer: Hi! 

I don't fully understand your question; I presume you're talking about an essay that you're writing. Generally, your "conclusion" is what you decide about an issue based on your "analysis" of the facts and other arguments.

So, the analysis part is very important. This is where you look at facts and evidence that support and that refute an issue or thesis. 

The analysis part is like you're a judge in a court room. You're hearing the evidence from the prosecution (against) about an issue and from the defence (for). You're judging the evidence. Some of it (regardless of sides) will be right, some of it will be wrong, and some of it will be irrelevant. Then from your evaluation of all the evidence, you decide (conclude) whether you agree or disagree with the issue.

I hope this helps!

label: Entertainment & Music
sentence:
Question: Is allofmp3.com and mp3sugar.com really legal?
Answer: Google "is allofmp3 legal" and you will find this nice answer from the EFF :
"Thanks for writing and sorry for the late reply. Before I say anything, I should point out that I am not an attorney and this is not legal advice. Unfortunately, the situation with AllofMP3 is, like many things, too good to be true. Whatever licenses or loopholes the site claims to have in Russia (which I would take with multiple grains of salt... or shots of vodka?), they don't extend to a U.S. citizen who downloads the content inside the U.S. That's where the copying takes place, and that's where the parties have to have a license to make copies. If they don't (and they don't), then you could be in trouble if the files were found on your computer. One interesting extra-legal thing to consider is that it's harder for the RIAA to get the names of people who use AllofMP3 in order to prosecute them, but that may not be true forever. Hope that helps!"

PS

Title: What is "stages of symbolic play"?
Question: Hi, I'm a student studying Early Childhood Education.
I still don't understand "stages of symbolic play".
Could you please tell me what it is?
Answer: check out that link. i see "stages of play" and "symbollic play" is one of them, is that what you need?

Symbolic Play:
Symbolic play is when children begin to substitute one object for another. For a 3- or 4-year-old toddler, a pillowcase becomes a superhero cape and the cardboard core of a roll of paper towels is used as a trumpet.
By age 4 or 5, a child's ideas and experiences with family and the social world provide material for games like 'house' or 'driving the car.' While some play is solitary or shared with adults, most symbolic play takes place with school peers or neighborhood buddies. Kids this age also adore construction play, building (with toys like Lego or blocks), and rough and tumble play (like ring-around-the-rosy).

label: Society & Culture
sentence:
Question: What type of fruit did eve eat?
Answer: The Book of Enoch 31:4, purporting to be written by the antediluvian prophet Enoch, describes the tree of knowledge as follows:

"It was like a species of the tamarind tree, bearing fruit which resembled grapes extremely fine; and its fragrance extended to a considerable distance. I exclaimed, How beautiful is this tree, and how delightful is its appearance!" 
In western art, the fruit is most commonly depicted as an apple. One possible reason for this arises from a medieval pun. It was a source of humor to monks that the Latin term for evil (malus) was similar to the word of apple (malum). Thus it was often said that by eating the malum (apple), Eve contracted malus (evil). There is, however, no textual or historical evidence by which to argue the literalness of this image.

Jewish thought contains additional options. Rabbi Meir says: "The fruit of (the Tree of Knowledge of Good-and-Evil) was a grape..."; Rabbi Nechemia says: "It was a fig..."; Rabbi Yehuda says: "It was wheat..." Talmud, Brachot 40a

The reason it is sometimes surmised to have been a fig is that they used fig leaves to cover themself after eating it, either because the leaves were nearby, or because God creates the cure before the illness, and the same tree that caused the problem is also used to remedy it. Another explanation lies within the "fruit" of the fig tree, the fig itself, which is not actually a fruit but rather a flower of sorts, serving as the tree's genitalia. It is said that when they bit into the fig, they saw that what appeared to be a fruit on the outside had concealed the reproductive organs within itself. Adam and Eve then looked at each other and felt ashamed that their reproductive organs were simply exposed, and covered them with the large leaves from the same tree. Some commentators hold that it might have been a grape, and that Eve actually made, and drank, wine.

Ethno-botanists have proposed the iboga plant (Tabernanthe iboga) as the Tree of Knowledge. The ground up bark contains a dissociative substance, ibogaine, which has been traditionally used in Bwiti religious ceremony in Central Africa. Other hallucinogens, in particular the Fly agaric mushroom, have also been proposed as the Tree.

Christian sects like the Coptics of Jamaica, and other peoples of faith, especially the Rastafarians believe it to be the Marijuana plant.

label: Family & Relationships
sentence:
Title: Is it wrong to pick up a girl on the rebound.?
Question: This girl just got dissed by a guy she really liked, so is it wrong to pick her up on the rebound.... She knows I have the biggest crush on her.....
Answer: Wrong?  That's for you to decide, but here's some food for thought.

She needs your friendship.  If you give her friendship without going for anything more right now, it shows her respect.  Then, when she is less vulnerable, if the two of you get together she will respect you more and you will be able to trust that she's with you for the right reasons and not simply out of need.

If the two of you got involved right now, it might be for the wrong reasons at the wrong time and thus set you up for failure down the road.

If you are "right" together, then it won't hurt for you to be her best friend and hold off on the other stuff for a while out of respect for her temporary vulnerability and genuine love or care for her.

Just something to consider.  Good luck!

Question: Hi,could someone tell me how to get a xbox hard drive to work on my pc?
Answer: The hard drive is IDE, but has been partitioned/formatted in an odd way, specific to Xbox. Assuming you have windows XP, you need to delete the existing partition and create a new one. After that you can format it and use it like any other hard drive.  To delete/create partitions, you need to go into the control panel -> administrative tools -> computer management -> disk management. Then select the xbox drive, then delete the existing partition, then create a new one - either NTFS or FAT32. Then format it.  The xbox drives are very small - why bother? ;-)

Question: I had a very bad car accident on January the 6th of this year. I broke my right leg (fibula) shattered my ankle and foot (if it wasn't because my leg had a pulse, they would've amputated it). It's been 6 months and I'm still in a lot of pain...I take Percocet 10/325 every 4hrs and sometimes it's not even enough. This makes me wonder if I'll ever be able to walk again (without crutches) and it makes me so sad. Has anybody been in a similar situation? How long did it take you to recover and how was the process? I would really appreciate it if you could help me understand my recovery better. Thank you so much.
Answer: speaking from experience..i broke my leg in 2 place and my wrist in 9 during the same accident.I was out of work for 6 months..i waited and rested as told but also kept stretching and flexing my foot and hand to keep things in motion. if you have had it immobilized for this entire time it will take some rehab.. you may also look at the possibility that your hooked on your pain meds. they will trick your brain into thinking your in pain just so you'll take more. Be careful and good luck

Title: for everyone that just answered my question concerning bleeding from the anus?
Question: i have just added more details and would welcome your input.\ni have indulged in anal sex and am not a smoker or heavy drinker and also slightly over weight. so please return to the original question.
Answer: Rectal bleeding has many causes including hemorrhoids, Crohn's Disease, fissures, peptic ulcer disease, polyps, amongst other reasons. Most rectal bleeding comes from the colon, rectum, or anus. The color of the blood often depends on the location of the bleeding in the gastrointestinal tract. The closer the bleeding site is to the anus, the blood will be a brighter red. Bleeding from the transverse colon and the right colon tend to be dark red or maroon colored. It would be best to see your doctor to determine what the exact cause may be.

Title: EBay question?  I bought something on May 8th.  It has still not arrived.?
Question: Was supposed to be shipped parcel post, estimated to take 2-9 days for delivery.  Seller contacted me 5/22 and asked if I had recieved the item and that she had been having some problems with her shipments.  I told her I had not recieved it yet.  Then, last night, I get a response from her saying, "Just letting you know i shipped your item.  This is just a friendly reminder".  WHAT does that mean?? I emailed her back and asked if the other people she had "problems" with eventually recieved their items, when she shipped my item, and the tracking number.  If i did not purchase shipping insurance (have never had a problem like this before) can I do anything to get my money back???
Answer: Did the seller respond to your last email? 

Contact Paypal. If the seller cannot provide proof of delivery, then Paypal will issue you a refund--from the seller's account. 

If there is a tracking number or a delivery confirmation number, you can tell when the package was shipped, maybe she just shipped it a couple of days ago.  

If you leave her negative feedback, most likely she'll leave negative feedback for you too, so I'd think about that one. You can always leave neutral feedback if the package shows up and she was just slow to ship it.

label: Health
sentence:
Title: pacemakers?
Question: well my dad's a little older than the average 14 year old's. [[try 79 years old]] and he could possibly need a pacemaker. he's suffered from heart failure, and smoked about 50 years of his life. the way my mom described a pacemaker thing she said they have a procedure to put something on his heart to make it beat better. is this what it is? and could it possibly hurt my dad??? are there any dangers in a pacemaker??\n\ni'm really nervous and don't know what to think...
Answer: well let me assure you it wouldn't hurt him except the surgery. i am 22 and have had 2 pacer (my nickname for pacemaker) surgeies coming up on my third. and while i am very tired and hurting after the surgery, i live a normal life after the healing. now i am not saying you dad will be fine it sounds like he is kinda not healthy with the smoking and all but the pacer won't hurt the situation it'll help. he might be even better after the surgery, more active and stuff, better chance at living longer. the surgey (for most are outpatient which means you pretty much get to go home in the same day) goes like this there is a small disk about the thickness of a cd case slightly bigger maybe 1 and 1/2 cd cases. and round about the size of the top of a pop can. it has two leads (two covered wires) that came out of the disk. they have a small screw on the end of each lead which are screwed into the heart, no worries that doesn't hurt. once the leads are in place chances are they will be there forever they don't go bad and are detachable at the disk end for repacemant surgies. which depends on how much his heart uses it. i use mine 100% of the time and i get about six years out of mine. they put the disk in your shoulder (mines' on the left), or sometimes older ppl have a bag with the disk in it but i think that's for ppl even older. then if they put it in your shoulder they sew you up and leave a scar about two inches wide, and not even an inch thick. the pacer from day one will shock his heart into working kinda similar to the paddles in the er but not quite. it doesn't hurt and you don't even notice it most the time. the only time i feel mine is right before i go to sleep if i hold real still i can feel a slight bump  from the inside but it doesn't hurt i think it's kinda cool and i usually laugh just a little at the thought of what it just was. sometimes i forget i have a pacer and other then being wary of big magnets (which shut off pacers) and playing football (a hard knock to the pacer could possably dislodge the leads) i live a full and happy life. without it i couldn't be here. so your dad has a great chance of being just fine. just be there for him and don't bump his shoulder for at least awhile it does hurt, just like any stiches would. praying wouldn't hurt and don't worry the pacer won't hurt him.

Title: Inside tornados....?
Question: There are a handful on anecdotal reports of people finding themselves inside of tornados and living to tell about it. Are any of these confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt? Where would I find them?
Answer: i was squirrel hunting once when i was 18 and noticed that suddenly everything seemed really green like i was looking through green glass or something. the wind wasnt blowing at all but i could hear howling winds. i walked out of the woods into a field so i could look at the sky and get a good look around because this confused me. no sooner had i reached the field that i saw a twister in the sky. quickly recalling what to do i jumped in a nearby trench and lied down, clenching the grass around me...but i couldnt resist watching it so i lied on my back. at one moment i swear it was only 100 yards or so above me and i could see straight up the middle of it to the sky above. during those long but short 15-20 seconds or so there was literally no wind whatsoever but the sound was immense, almost deffaning. it gave me such an adrenaline rush that nowadays tornadic storms turn me on. then i watched it land on a chicken barn about 1/2 a mile from me and destroy it. the news said that it had jumped from place to place for several hours. all i know is that it was very close to me and i saw the inside of it and it was alot like in the movies when people are momentarily safe inside a twister, but i wasnt lifted off the ground because i was below the ground level in that ditch. i guess its possible

Title: Multiple part question:  1. Have you seen Fahrenheit 9/11?
Question: 2. What was your opinion on the President before watching it?
3. Did your opinion change?
4. Have you heard of FahrenHYPE 9/11?  If so, have you seen it?
5. Do you think that a person who hates somebody can make an unbiased movie about them?  Or would they try to sway the viewers into thinking like them using clever editing?

This is an independent poll I'm conducting.  I'd love to see some intelligence...and I promise to award best answer not to the person who completely agrees with me, but whoever has the most intelligent response.  Thanks in advance!
Answer: 1. No.
2. I think President Bush was doing an OUTSTANDING job.
3. N/A.
4. Yes. No.
5. No.

Given some of the political views I have posted on Y!A, it might surprise some people to find out that I refuse to watch either film. Both filmmakers have an obvious agenda, and you can trust neither to be unbiased. It is too easy today to twist facts and edit video to make it say whatever you want - as these two obviously have. I am interested in learning FACTS. My OPINIONS do not need help being shaped from either Michael Moore or Alan Peterson.

The better documentaries about 9/11 have explored both sides of the events while ignoring obvious left and right-wing propaganda. President Bush's response on 9/11 was not perfect; he DID make some mistakes. But he did a lot of things right, too.

KSM (Khalid Sheik Mohammed - that real hairy bastard nabbed in Pakistan a year or so back) has stated in interrogation that al Qaida had planned MORE attacks on the US immediately following 9/11. What al Qaida had NOT expected, however, was President Bush's response. Al Qaida expected a few cruise missiles as an answer, and then life would go on. The Bush Doctrine ("you are either with us or against us") and the military operations that accompanied it totally threw al Qaida for a loop and disrupted any chance they had of launching another operation.

The KSM statement alone shows that President Bush has done his job and saved the lives of THOUSANDS - if not tens or hundreds of thousands - of American lives.

label: Society & Culture
sentence:
Question: What was your biggest Thanksgiving disaster - and how could you have prevented it?
Answer: It was the first Thanksgiving after my husband and I started dating.  He drove three hours to spend the holiday weekend with me so I wanted to impress him with a home cooked meal.  I waited until leaving work Wednesday night to go the the grocery store and in the mad push of people, I reached in the bin and grabbed a turkey.  The next afternoon, I placed my turkey in a sink full of water to thaw and began on my side dishes.  After he arrived and we had a drink, he ventured into the kitchen at which point I noticed he was peering down into the sink and frowning.  I asked if something was wrong with the turkey and he said "Yeah . . . it's a duck."  

To my horror, I had picked up a duck and never noticed that this long narrow bird was not a fat round turkey.  I attempted to roast it and while it had a nice flavor, we quickly realized there isn't much meat on a duck.  In addition, my gravy was burnt, my potatoes were salty and the macaroni and cheese was a solid block.  I finally accepted defeat and we ventured out to the local 7-Eleven and had a Thanksgiving hot dog!   

I wouldn't have done a thing to prevent it!!  That night my husband told me he loved me for the first time and we have been together for over twelve years.  He turned out to be an incredible cook and  I have never cooked another Thanksgiving dinner!  And every year we toast our famous Thanksgiving duck!

Question: where on line can I find when a small incorporated business was started?
Answer: if you google the name of the state in which you live along with the phrase "division of corporations", you should get some links to a state government site where you can look up the corporation by name. (if you don't know the exact corporate name, it will usually come up with a list of similar names, and you can probably pick out the one you're looking for).

It will usually list the date the business was incorporated (keep in mind that a business could have been in existence prior to actually incorporating, but the Div. of Corp. site should give you the date the business was officially incorporated).

It should also tell you if the corporation is still "active" or not. (Corporations must pay annual fees to the state in order to keep their status active).

Good luck

Title: When should i test?
Question: When should i test?
ok here is my story. i had my period in spetember from the 22-24th which was lighter than normal, in october i had it on the 24th which was four days late and only lasted one day. i haven't had a period this month yet but i have been tired all the time, been getting headaches, the skina round my nipples has gotten really dark, my breast are tender to the touch expecially around the nipples, i have been sick to my stomach everyday for the last couple of weeks i am trying to figure out when my period should come this month and when i should take a pregnancy test....can anyone help me? serious answers please!!!!
Answer: You could test now if you want, but I would wait until Thursday, 11/24.  Also, go ahead and make the Dr's appointment.  I would worry about the last period you had.  It sounds to me like maybe you really didn't have one.  Maybe you only had some spotting.  You may very well be getting to 8 weeks of pregnancy.  

I am not a doctor so I can't be sure.  You can do an over the counter test.  Buy one that has two tests in it so you can take one tonight and then one on Thursday.  If you test positive, you will know.  If negative, you will know to retest on Thursday.  

If you period does not start by this weekend, you know that something is definitely wrong.  You will already have a doctor's appointment made for potentially next week and you will know soon what is going on with your body!

Good luck!

Question: I have been having problems with the mormons yet again.  

On Saturday my wife and I were making love when I though I heard the door go. We were expecting a couple we know to arrive. So I went to the door without changing. I had on some rubber bondage gear and rubber restraints on my arms which were very tight (I am not into this stuff, I just do it for the wife). 

I was greated by two mormon missionaries, aged about 20, in suits with bibles in hand.

Now My wife and I are tolerant. But as born again christians, my wife and I don´t want to discuss our faith with those from the Church of the Latter Day Saints. We say live and let live, it´s just that it is not our thing. 

Those guys just wouldn´t leave. They asked to come in. The one on the left looked at me funny. In the end I had to shut the door on them. I didn´t want to but after fifteen minutes, I was losing the circulation in my arms and could not feel my hands. 

Is it me, or are these mormon missionaries too pushy?

Why just the other day I was in the process of making a burnt offering an ox on the alter that I have erected on my front lawn (To get the Lord to rig the next power ball drawing for me, as per the bible, book of Carbonization, 23-10), when I was accosted by a pair of LDS missionaries.  They actually had the audacity to interrupt my opening benediction to ask if I was interested in their religion, and whats more, their caterwauling frightened the ox, who snapped his restraints and bolted, leaving me with a roaring fire, some very sharp knives, and two belligerent missionaries.

label: Society & Culture
sentence:
Title: tell me everything you know about faternities and sororities? Everything?
Question: what is there purpose? what are the advantages and didadvantages. what can they do for you.
Answer: It really upsets me to read an answer like the prejudiced person before me left for you.  She has no right to answer or give an opinion since she was never part of a Greek organization, although she clearly seems jealous that she wasn't....

Greek life is wonderful and it can really enhance your college life, as well as later in life. I've remained close to many of my "sisters" over the years. Putting my sorority on my resume even helped my land a job at a big company. I was told by HR that people who've been in Greek organizations have a higher likelihood of being successful in the workplace than those who weren't. I don't know if it's true, but it's worth considering. 

My significant other was in a fraternity and is still close with all of his "brothers" as well. They still have get togethers a few times a year and help out with their chapter when needed.

Do not think or let anyone ever tell you that being in a sorority is like buying friends. ALL organizations have dues...even my son's PTA organization. The cost pays for the parties and other supplies needed for get togethers and charity events. It's no different than paying for any other organization.

As for disadvantages, I suppose you might close yourself off to other organizations, as they do take up a lot of time.  Greek organizations are not just about partying, contrary to popular belief.  We partied hard, but we also participated in Adopt A Highway, Soup Kitchens, local elementary schools, donated money to a school for deaf children and helped to spread information about safe sex to high school and college freshmen students, just to name a few.

Hope this helps.

label: Society & Culture
sentence:
Title: Have you felt,  or feel now, that God has abandoned you? Have you realized then its you who abandoned him?
Question: I've been going through a long period of time when I don't feel close to God anymore, and I can't seem to pray. It began when I felt he abandoned me and I was betrayed about how my dying mother was treated by a hospice staff. I guess I've felt guilty that I couldn't care for her at home in the end, but had to let her be put in the hospice facility. I'd promised her I'd care for her, and she was so frightened when they took her away from my home and they wouldn't let me ride with her. It's been a haunting memory and experience.

I stopped praying. It has just been too hard too. It doesn't seem the same as it once was. I realize God didn't abandon me, or my mother, and that I've not been faithful to him and haven't tried to pray with any real effort. I feel it should come more naturally.

What do you think about my failure to pray and the bitterness I've harbored about the way my mother died? What do you suggest as to how I could pray again?
Answer: I lost a loved one on christmas day, came home from church that day an dwas told that a loved one have just passed away. i was ticked off because I was at church during that time asking "god" to help this person out during their time of need. 
Since then my resentment for pray and god has grown. 
In fact I had started to question the concept of god and religion more than ever and then after a few years have realized that god does not exist and that religion is used to exploit the ignorance of people.

Things happen in life, people die whether by illness, accident, or other situations. What should matter is keeping their memories in your heart and never forgetting the good time that you have had with your loved one. But also cheerish their advice that was given to you. 

If there was a god both my prayers and yours would have been answered by "god"
